name: Overdeities
description: The overdeities are a collection of Xarians who, in one way or another, harnessed the power of an ancient singularity in the Astral Sea, using it to ascend to godhood. Their power far eclipses that of all other gods.

gods.name: [null]
gods.symbol: A sphere surrounded by a spiked ring

gods.name: Ouroborus
gods.symbol: A white constrictor snake eating its own tail

gods.name: Quilrith
gods.symbol: A great beast's head in profile

name: Faerûnian Pantheon
description: The Faerûnian pantheon is the pantheon primarily worshipped by the continent of Faerûn on the world of Toril in Realmspace. Though they are the gods of Realmspace, the Faerûnian gods wield significant power outside of their sphere, something quite unusual for sphere gods.

gods.name: Cyric
gods.symbol: White skull on a purple starburst

gods.name: Gwaeron
gods.symbol: A paw print with a star at its center

gods.name: Gzemnid
gods.symbol: An eye surrounded by ten smaller eyes

gods.name: Hoar
gods.symbol: A coin with a two-faced head

gods.name: Jergal
gods.symbol: Skull and quill on a scroll

gods.name: Leira
gods.symbol: Triangle containing a swirl of mist

gods.name: Mystra
gods.symbol: Nine stars encircling a red mist

gods.name: Nobanion
gods.symbol: Lion's head on a green shield

gods.name: Nyx
gods.symbol: Crescent moon in front of wings

gods.name: Shaundakul
gods.symbol: A path drawn on a map

gods.name: Talos
gods.symbol: Three lightning bolts radiating from a point

name: Oerdian Pantheon
description: The Oerdian patheon is the pantheon primarily worshipped by the world of Oerth in Grayspace. The gods of Oerth are the oldest sphere gods, and their numbers are so vast that to list all of them would be impossible.

gods.name: Cuthbert
gods.symbol: Circle at the center of a starburst

gods.name: Fharlanghn
gods.symbol: Circle crossed by a curved line

gods.name: Kord
gods.symbol: Four spears and four maces radiating out

gods.name: Kyuss
gods.symbol: A skull with worms in its eyes

gods.name: Rudd
gods.symbol: Target with an arrow in its bullseye

gods.name: Ulaa
gods.symbol: Mountain with a circle at its center

gods.name: Vecna
gods.symbol: Hand with an eye in its palm

gods.name: Wee Jas
gods.symbol: Red skull in front of a fireball

gods.name: Zilchus
gods.symbol: Hands clutching a bag of gold

name: Krynnic Pantheon
description: The Krynnic pantheon is the pantheon primarily worshipped by the world of Krynn in Krynnspace. Most Krynnic gods are ruthless, seeing mortals as little more than chess pieces on the great board that is the surface of Krynn.

name: Beric Pantheon
description: The Beric pantheon is the pantheon primarily worshipped by the world of Eberron in Berspace. The Beric pantheon is among the youngest of the sphere gods, and are themselves still recovering from Eberron's great history of warfare.

gods.name: Arawai
gods.symbol: Sheaf of wheat tied with green ribbon

gods.name: Fury
gods.symbol: Winged wyrm with a woman's head

name: Clutch of Io (Draconic Pantheon)
description: The Clutch of Io is the ancient draconic pantheon originating from the sphere of Thenispace. Their power is innately bound to their home sphere, but their draconic nature allows them to wield significant power outside of their sphere.

gods.name: Kereska
gods.symbol: A five-pointed star with the lower two points extended

gods.name: Lendys
gods.symbol: A golden sword and a sun

gods.name: Task
gods.symbol: A pile of five coins, each coin stamped with a dragon's head in profile

gods.name: Tiamat
gods.symbol: The heads of all five species of chromatic dragons

name: Seldarine (Elvish Pantheon)
description: The Seldarine is the elvish pantheon. Most of them have some connection to the Feywild, and the first among them were among the first gods created by Praeteria and Ao.

gods.name: Tethrin
gods.symbol: Crossed swords above a full moon

name: Dark Seldarine (Drow Pantheon)
description: The Dark Seldarine is the pantheon worshipped by specifically drow, or dark elves. Long ago, they split away from the Seldarine when Lolth was banished after her war. The Dark Seldarine is among the most loosely organized pantheons, only being gesturally ruled by Lolth.

gods.name: Elistraee
gods.portfolio: Beauty, Dance, Freedom, Moon, Hunting, Song

gods.name: Selvetarm
gods.symbol: Spider over crossed sword and mace

name: Morndinsamman (Dwarvish Pantheon)
description: The Morndinsamman is the dwarvish pantheon. They are a tightly-knit clan of dwarven shield brothers and sisters. Sometimes, the Morndinsamman is called upon by the overdeities to serve as powerful warriors.

gods.name: Marthammor
gods.symbol: Mace in front of a boot

name: Lords of the Golden Hills (Gnomish Pantheon)
description: The Lords of the Golden Hills is the gnomish pantheon. They are among the pantheons most involved in the lives of their worshippers, but they usually just send avatars instead of acting themselves.

name: Tribe of He Who Watches (Orcish Pantheon)
description: The Tribe of He Who Watches is the orcish pantheon. They are a brutal collection of little more than barbarians who bully the orcs into worshipping them. The Tribe has a long, bloody history with the Seldarine, which started when Corellon Larethian stabbed out one of Gruumsh's eyes.

gods.name: Gruumsh
gods.portfolio: Conquest, Destruction, Storms, Strength, Survival, War

name: Ordning (Giant Pantheon)
description: The Ordning is both the name for the giant pantheon, and the name for the system of ranking that permeates all of giant society. Even the pantheon itself is subject to this ranking, with Annam and Stronmaus near the top of the Ordning and Grolantor and Vaprak near the bottom.

gods.name: Annam
gods.symbol: Two hands, wrists crossed with fingers pointing down

gods.name: Stronmaus
gods.portfolio: Sea, Sky, Storm Giants, Sun, Weather

name: Egyptian Pantheon
description: The Egyptian pantheon, so named for its connections to the Primespace state of Egypt, is a pantheon worshipped across the multiverse. They have numerous names, such as the Pharaonic pantheon or the Mulhorandi pantheon.

name: Olympian Pantheon
description: The Olympian pantheon is a collection of gods that live primarily in the realm of Olympus found within Arborea. Even the good Olympian gods are extremely selfish, petty, and unpredictable beings, and it's frankly a miracle they get anything done with how much they bicker. Most of the Olympian gods are in some way related to Zeus, the king of their pantheon.

gods.name: Artemis
gods.symbol: Bow and arrow on crescent moon

gods.name: Atlas
gods.symbol: Globe being held by a crouched man

name: Celtic Pantheon
description: The Celtic pantheon, so named for its connections to the Primespace peoples of the Celts, is a pantheon worshipped across the multiverse. Celtic gods tend to be more druidic or shamanic than most other gods, and their clerics are more primitive in their magic.

name: Ysgardian Pantheon
description: The Ysgardian pantheon is a collection of gods that live primarily in the plane of Ysgard. Most of the Ysgardian gods are warlike and rowdy, relative to other pantheons.

gods.name: Hel
gods.symbol: Woman's face, rotting on one side

name: Hammerspace Pantheon
description: The Hammerspace pantheon is a collection of gods from the sphere of Hammerspace. Most of these gods are little more than ascended demon lords who were sealed in Hammerspace by powerful magic long ago. None are truly good, and most serve to keep Hammerspace itself in a state of constant, brutal warfare. While the Hammerspace gods are extremely powerful within their sphere, they pale in comparison to even the weakest of multiversal gods.

gods.name: Nurgle
gods.symbol: Three green arrows and three green circles

gods.name: Slaanesh
gods.symbol: A combination of the male and female gender icons

gods.name: Tzeentch
gods.symbol: An eye and a blue flame

name: Eldritch Pantheon
description: The Eldritch pantheon are, or perhaps were, a group of supremely ancient gods. They are entirely unknowable to mortals, and their very presence can bring madness. Most of the Eldritch gods are connected to the Astral Plane itself, and most theologists question if they even still live.

gods.name: Nyarlathotep
gods.portfolio: Conspiracies, Secrets, Forbidden Magic, Corruption, Vengeance
